description: Japanese spikenard (Aralia cordata 'Sun King') is an amazing and unique plant species. It is native to Japan and has foliage with yellow to orange hues. It has a texture similar to ferns, with leaflets that have serrated edges. It's name comes from the sharp, spiky appearance of the leaves. The bright yellow flowers are produced in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. Japanese spikenard is highly decorative, and the bold colors make it stand out in any garden. It is also known for its adaptation to various soil types, making it an easy-to-grow plant. It is a great choice for atmospheric and colorful landscaping schemes, and it makes a great addition to most gardens.
